It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding structure. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
